item.title: Internet Infrastructure and the Persistent Myth of U.S. Hegemony
item.description: Winseck Dwayne. “Internet Infrastructure and the Persistent Myth of U.S. Hegemony.” In Information, Technology and Control in a Changing World: Understanding Power Structures in the 21st Century. Blayne Haggart, Kathryn Henne, Natasha Tusikov, editors. 93-120. Cham: Palgrave Macmillan, 2019. According to many observers, economic globalisation and the liberalisation of telecoms/internet policy have remade the world in the image of the United States. The dominant role of Amazon, Apple, Facebook, and Google has also led to charges of U.
